title: Is it worth it to get a literary agent when attempting to publish? - Quora

response.answer_text: Agents add value. These days, things are complex, with foreign rights, movie rights, digital rights, ad nauseum. Agents can get your work on the right track, from the get-go.  Finding a good agent is no easy task. I'd suggest building your platform first.For example, Penana - Creating a Storyworld is a way to write in real-time fashion and build a fan base. It's all about eyeballs.

If you plan on going the traditional publishing route, a literary agent is imperative. Most big publishers won't even accept works without a representative agent. However, if you do not wish to work with an agent, you can look into site like command z editing, Inkshares, and Kickstarter. The former is a agent-esque site with a one time flat fee, while the two latter are crowd sourcing forms of publishing
